snippet: In prepared testimony, the Obama administration’s top intelligence official said that Iran has become more willing to carry out attacks inside the United States.
abstract: National Intelligence Director James R Clapper Jr delivers prepared testimony to the Senate Intelligence Committee, stating that some senior Iranian leaders are now more willing to carry out attacks in the United States in response to perceived American threats; cites suspected 2011 plot to assassinate the Saudi ambassador to Washington; also warns of growing cyberattack risk in the wake of Arab Spring uprisings.
lead_paragraph: In prepared testimony, the Obama administration’s top intelligence official said that Iran has become more willing to carry out attacks inside the United States.

headline.main: Intelligence Report Lists Iran and Cyberattacks as Leading Concerns
headline.print_headline: Annual Intelligence Report Lists Iran and Cyberattacks as Leading Concerns

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
